attributes.action: resist China's attempt to lift the international ban on the sale of tiger products
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Chinese government is seeking to lift the international ban. Under fierce pressure from tiger farms the Chinese government claims the current ban has cost their economy £2 billion and done little to stem the fall in tiger numbers across Asia.

Tiger products like bone have medicinal and aphrodisiac properties, but there are a significant number of Chinese medical practitioners who say tiger bone can be substituted by other animals.

China should begin enforcing the ban rather than have it lifted
